content.raw:
I've removed the dependency on newer labscript_utils for the wait completed events - instead, the plugin looks for a connection table
attribute on the wait monitor device, if any, called 'wait_monitor_supports_wait_completed_events'. If the poperty is present and True, then it waits for these events, otherwise it just skips over waits and show an icon as a warning that it may be unreliable if waits are not very short. The icon has a tooltip explaining this.

Since this no longer has a dependency on anything, I'll test it on a real setup and then merge if it's all good.
content.html:
I've removed the dependency on newer labscript_utils for the wait completed events - instead, the plugin looks for a connection table attribute on the wait monitor device, if any, called 'wait_monitor_supports_wait_completed_events'. If the poperty is present and True, then it waits for these events, otherwise it just skips over waits and show an icon as a warning that it may be unreliable if waits are not very short. The icon has a tooltip explaining this.

Since this no longer has a dependency on anything, I'll test it on a real setup and then merge if it's all good.
